oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Comparison of two methods for collecting antimicrobial usage in large dairy farms in Ohio and California
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Portillo-Gonzalez, R.
Garzon-Audor, A.
Pereira, R.
Habing, G.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Quantification of on-farm antimicrobial use (AMU) is critical to correlate with patterns of antimicrobial resistance, surveilÂ­lance programs and formulate interventions to optimize its use. Prior studies have used the empty drug container (EDC) method to quantify AMU; however, the method is labor-intensive and time-consuming. Therefore, this study aimed to compare it against farm treatment records (FTR) as a reliable method to collect on-farm AMU. We hypothesized a low level of agreement in on-farm treatment incidence (TI) obtained between these 2 different collection methods.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; No. 56 (2023): 2023 Annual Conference Proceedings ; 242
